intro: Pseudocodon vinciflorus subsp. vinciflorus, commonly known as the Virginia buttonweed, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. It produces small, oval fruits that are dispersed by wind, contributing to its spread. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and botanical gardens.
